names.pinyin: huo xue hua yu run chang tang
names.english: decoction for looseniing the bowel with herbs that invigorate the blood and break up stasis
names.commonEnglish: Decoction for Loosening the Bowels with Herbs that Invigorate the Blood and Break up Stasis

actions: Breaks up Blood Stasis, invigorates the Blood, moistens the Intestines, unblocks the bowels and drains abscesses.
With Hong Hua, invigorates the Blood for all types of Blood Stagnation.
With Xing Ren, for constipation due Lung Qi Stagnation and Blood Stasis with pain in the chest, abdomen or throughout the body.
With Xing Ren and Huo Ma Ren, for chronic constipation due to Deficiency and/or Stagnation.
Strongly descends rebellious Qi.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, opens the channels and alleviates pain.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm, descends Rebellious Qi, stops vomiting, dissipates nodules, reduces Stagnation, treats sores, skin ulcerations and carbuncles and reduces swelling.
Nourishes Kidney Yin, clears Lung Heat, sedates Fire, moistens the Lungs, nourishes the Kidneys, generates fluids and resolves Phlegm.
Drains Heat, generates Fluids, clears and drains Lung Heat, transforms Phlegm, moistens Lung Dryness, relieves toxicity, expels pus and reduces swelling.
Nourishes, moistens and lubricates the Intestines, nourishes Yin, clears Heat and promotes healing of sores.
With Tao Ren and Dang Gui, for habitual constipation.
Clears Heat, cools and harmonizes the Blood, clears Deficiency Fire, invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, drains pus and reduces swelling.
Tonifies, Invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, moistens the Intestines, unblocks the bowels, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and stops pain due to Blood Stasis.
With Tao Ren and Hong Hua, for Blood Stasis.
Tonifies Qi and nourishes Yin.
Moistens the Intestines and unblocks bowels.
With Huo Ma Ren and Dang Gui, for constipation due to Deficient Qi and dry Intestines.
With Tao Ren, for Blood Stasis with pain in the chest, abdomen or throughout the body.
Invigorates, cools and nourishes the Blood, relieves Heat, detoxifies, promotes diuresis, dissipates nodulation and reduces swelling.
Breaks up Blood Stasis,
Invigorates the Blood
Moistens the Intestines
Unblocks the bowels
Nourishes Yin
Dissipate nodulation
Reduces swelling
syndromes: Kidney Yin Deficiency with Blood Stagnation

symptoms: Low back and knees sore and painful
A hard, palpable lump in the epigastrium
Facial color dark and dull or pale
Sides and ribs distended on both sides (maybe with sharp pain)
Enlargement of the Liver and Spleen
Women: Irregular menses or Scanty menses or Amenorrhea Vaginal discharge
